Whether they’re tricked out with bikini trimmers or gel strips that promise to eliminate the need for shaving cream, these aren’t your mother’s razors. Find out which razors lived up to their claims and which one will be tossed in the trash.

content.div:
Now that the sweltering summer heat is here, we’re on a hunt for that perfect waterproof eyeliner that won’t flake or run down our face. This week, we tested some of the best – and worst – products on the market. See which ones lived up to their claims and which ones will be tossed in the trash.



Lise Watier 24 Hrs Glam Eyeliner (Suggested retail price: $21.00; available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“Look: I’m sure the Lise Watier liquid eyeliner is fabulous. Really. But I simply don’t have the steady hands and the makeup skills to apply liquid eyeliner properly; I will always end up with janky-looking eyes no matter how hard I try. And yes, I’ve tried the whole ‘rest your hand on your cheek for stability’ trick – no dice. However, I did like the how the eyeliner sparkled, so maybe one day I’ll master this whole liquid eyeliner thing so my eyes can pop. Rating: I can’t rate the eyeliner, but my application skills are 0/5.” – Kat Angus

"This one surprised me. At first I wasn’t aware that it had some sparkle to it or that it would be a liquid liner. I don’t normally wear any shimmer/sparkly type makeup, but I was pleasantly surprised with the final look. I’m quite familiar with liquid liners so I found this very easy to apply and I noticed that the liner dried almost immediately, which definitely creates a long-lasting finish. By the end of the day, my eyeliner still looked great and with some make up remover, face wash, and a bit of scrubbing, I was able to remove it. Overall, I really did like this product, but I wouldn’t wear it on a normal work day. I will save this for going out at night and on weekends if I want a little extra shimmer. Rating: 4/5." -Kim D'Amato

"This eyeliner was easy to apply and did a great job of defining my eyes. It lasted the whole day without smudging, but it took a bit of extra care to remove because it is super waterproof. I would wear this for a more dramatic look at night. Rating: 4/5." -Jennifer Simone

“I love eyeliner, but it's rare that I ever play with the liquid variety. For those curious to switch to the liquid side, 24 Hrs Glam proved to be an easy-peasy introduction. Thanks to its quick-drying formula, any wobbly handiwork on my part never risked unsightly smudges. (Though I'm not sure I really had any clumsy moments; the fine brush applicator proved to be simpler than some pencils to work with.) Of course, sometimes smudging can be a good thing -- and if you're interested in blending or creating a smoky effect around your eyelashes, this Lise Watier product is hardly ideal. But once it's on, it's on -- for a precise look that'll endure through a full work day. (You'll forgive me for not leaving it on the full advertised 24 hours, but I can at least attest to it wiping off cleanly with a dab of eye makeup remover.) Rating: 4.5 out of 5” -Leah Collins

"I’m no stranger to eyeliner. For the past ten years, I’ve worn it pretty much every day. But despite my decade of practice, I’d never managed to line my upper lids without making a squiggly, unsightly mess. I don’t know how Lise Watier did it, but somehow they invented a liquid eyeliner that looks amazing even when applied by an (exceptionally) unskilled hand. With a couple of quick swipes, I had the doubly-thick lash line I’d been dreaming of, complete with a few subtle sparkles for extra glam. The price may be a tad off-putting, but don’t worry - it’s so unbelievably waterproof that you’ll probably only have to apply it once - ever. (Seriously, how do you get this stuff off?) But despite the price and removal challenges, it’s still my favourite eyeliner of the bunch. Rating: 5/5" -Jaclyn Desforges


Annabelle Smoothliner (Suggested retail price: $6.50; available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“The Annabelle liner was perfect for creating the smoky eye look; I can manage eyeliner as long as I’m allowed to blend it after applying it. The stuff even lasted through an entire night of sweaty dancing in a club; there were no raccoon eyes to be found at the end of the evening. Of course, this meant it was a bit of a challenge to remove when I actually wanted to take it off, because I didn’t want to scrub too hard, lest my eyelashes start to fall out. A few minutes of gentle rubbing with a washcloth eventually got my eyes clean, though, so it all turned out well in the end. Rating: 4/5” – Kat Angus

“Yes, the Smoothliner is smooth to apply. It's also equally smooth to smudge off. One careless eye-rub and it's gone -- leaving grey circles to remember it by. In case you've always wanted to be one fur coat and an overturned can of garbage away from being a raccoon, have at 'er. Rating: 1/5” -Leah Collins

"This product was easy to apply and very smooth going on. It’s a nice colour -- kind of a metallic grey. It didn’t smudge too much but also didn’t last too long. I couldn’t tell how “waterproof” it actually was because it didn’t last on my eyes throughout the day so I didn’t get a chance to try and wash it off. I don’t really understand the need for “waterproof” eyeliner in the first place – I get that you need waterproof mascara but eyeliner? It’s kind of like needing waterproof eye shadow and foundation … a bit of an unnecessary purchase unless you are a swimmer or cry a whole heck of a lot. Rating: it 2.5/5." Joanna Rizi

"If you're looking for easy application, the Smoothliner definitely lives up to its name -- until you have to sharpen it. The initial first use was fantastic; I almost was almost convinced that I was going to ditch my trusty MAC liner in exchange for this affordable drugstore brand, but I was wrong. Sharpening this little baby was anything but easy -- both on the hands and the eyes! It kept breaking apart, leaving jagged pieces behind, causing me to play a risky game of "is my eyeliner going to cause blindness today?!” Rating: 3/5." -Miranda Furtado


Bourjois Paris Contour Clubbing Waterproof Eyeliner (Suggested retail price: $17.00; available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“There's something about the name of this product that makes me think it was designed to protect Bar Stars overly accustomed to getting drinks thrown in their faces. (Be the biggest dick in the club, and still leave looking fabulous!) That said, Bourjois' Contour Clubbing Waterproof eyeliner's long-lasting abilities are nothing extraordinary, so expect it to fade and smudge throughout the day -- or "clubbing" night -- with or without the threat of water, Smirnoff Ice, or otherwise. Easy to blend with your other shadows and true to colour, however, this eyeliner would be a great pick for someone whose make-up bag is always stocked with the makings of a smoky eye -- and who rarely picks fights with drunk chicks. Rating: 3 out of 5” -Leah Collins

"After trying and loving the Bourjois mascara, I was excited to test the waterproof eyeliner. This liner went on very smooth and created a nice straight line without any smudging. As much as I love the easy application of this liner, it wasn’t very waterproof or long lasting. As the day went on, I noticed it started to smudge a little as my normal liners do. Since it wasn’t very waterproof, I could easily remove it with makeup remover and some face wash. I would definitely use this again; just maybe not as a waterproof eyeliner. Rating: 4/5." -Kim D'Amato


Stila Stay All Day Waterproof Liquid Eye Liner (Suggested retail price: $20.00; available at Sephora)

“All day eyeliner? If your day is short of eight hours, maybe. Despite its claims, I still suffered from The Smudgies by the end of my work day. And even while applying the stuff, those dreaded Smudgies showed themselves again -- though I'll at least attribute that to my lack of expertise with liquid liner. (The stuff stays wet several seconds after application.) Once on, though, the colour of my carbon black eyeliner stayed striking and true, and -- despite those aforementioned mishaps -- was simple to apply thanks to a marker tip. Rating: 3.5 out of 5” -Leah Collins

"I wore this eyeliner to the beach and it lasted all day through salt and salt water. The design of the tip allows for easy application – I was very impressed that I could create a thicker line on the top lid and a thinner line on the bottom. It was easy to remove with waterproof removal cream. This may be my favorite eyeliner and I will definitely buy it again. Rating: 5/5." -Jennifer Simone


Marcelle Waterproof Eyeliner (Suggested retail price: $9.95; available at Shoppers Drugmart)

"My previous experience with eyeliner consists entirely of bargain-basement brands. Maybe it’s the teensy size of eye pencils that inspires me to choose the $2 variety over the $10 every time, or the fact that eyeliner isn’t as noticeable as higher-profile cosmetics like lipstick or blush. But since trying this brand, I’ve decided to change my penny-pinching ways. There’s nothing particularly exciting about the Marcelle brand - no special features, no sparkles or rainbows or magical dancing unicorns. It’s just a well-made eyeliner that goes on easily and stays put all day so you don’t end up with raccoon eyes by four o’clock. Classic-looking and easy to use, I’d definitely buy it again. Rating: 4/5" -Jaclyn Desforges

"I’m not a big eyeliner person but I was excited to give this one a try because I really liked the colour (bronze), which seemed very light and neutral. The product went on nicely, it didn’t grab at the eyelid like some eyeliners tend to and it didn’t seem to smudge all over the place, but it also seemed to fade right after application. In the span of one day I applied it four times because it faded away so quickly. This could be because it was a light colour, but still it was annoying to have to re-apply something that many times in a day. Rating 2/5." -Joanna Rizi

"When applying the pencil liner, it was quite creamy and went on smoothly. It lasted all day for wear and it did the trick in making my eyes look larger. I didn’t even feel the need for mascara as this product offered a nice consistent thick line above my eyes on the first try. I liked that the fact that it was hypo-allergenic and one of the lower priced brands out there. Come removal time, it wasn’t waterproof like promised. The eyeliner came off quite nicely with just a couple splashes of water. Rating: 4/5." -Yvonne Yip

"I'm a fan of eyeliner, but not a fan of looking like a raccoon. This liner was super easy to apply and looked great for the first few hours but by mid-afternoon I was looking like I had just spent a night out on the town. It didn’t help that it was one of the hottest days that we've had to date this summer. But hot or not, I need my liner to last. Rating: 2/5." -Miranda Furtado


Rimmel Exaggerate Waterproof Eye Definer (Suggested retail price: $6.99; available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“The liner went on smooth and there was no need to sharpen, which is a big plus. Although the color was labelled as black it went on more a dark grey which turned me off. The durability was average and it came off fairly easily. In the future I may use this liner or recommend it based on the price and ease of use but only for everyday wear not for a night out or special event. Rating 2.5/5." -Robyn Kelly

"This eyeliner is easy to apply at first, but the sharp edge of the pencil quickly dulls, and there’s no way to sharpen it. Throughout the day it seemed to fade in colour. Since it was very easy to remove, I wonder how waterproof it actually is. Rating: 2.5/5." -Jennifer Simone

"This is a staple in my day-to-day makeup routine. The Rimmel liner goes on smooth and evenly across the eyelid and the smudge tip is great for creating softer looks. I love that you don't have to mess around with sharpeners or wood splinters stabbing you in the eye like other liners. It’s long-lasting and sweat-proof/waterproof and layers up nicely when combined with other colours in the product line (I blend Noir and Deep Ocean). My only minor problem is with the packaging. The smudge sponge tip isn't set permanently into the liner and often pops off when you take the protective cap off - so watch out for it rolling down the drain! Rating 5/5." -Bonnie Large

link.Abstract: We put our kissers to the test to find out which lip plumper could give us an Angelina Jolie pout. Find out which gloss flattened the competition and which ones left our lips less than luscious.
link.title: Angelina Jolie

entry.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Razors

link.Abstract: Now that the weather has finally warmed up, our ultimate beauty goal is super silky-smooth legs. Luckily for us, razors have become more advanced than ever. Whether they’re tricked out with bikini trimmers or gel strips that promise to eliminate the need for shaving cream, these aren’t your mother’s razors. Find out which razors lived up to their claims and which one will be tossed in the trash.
link.title: [ more ]
